Product description: This collection of primary Black CTC tea grades serves as a foundational component for large-batch wholesalers and packet tea brand owners across India. Sourced directly from major gardens in both the Assam and Dooars regions, these raw tea granules are selected for their high density and moisture stability. The liquor profile is characterized by a robust and strong body with a brisk infusion that holds its character even when blended. It is an ideal stock for institutional procurement, offering specific grades such as Broken Pekoe, Orange Fannings, and Primary Dust to meet diverse market demands. By sourcing this garden-fresh stock directly from the foothills, buyers benefit from significant competitive margins and the elimination of secondary trading commissions. This product ensures a reliable supply chain for businesses requiring high-volume raw material for retail packaging. Supplied by a wholesale tea supplier based in Siliguri, serving Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal.

Rajni Gold is a proprietary premium CTC tea blend specifically engineered for the retail market and family-mixture packeteers. This consistent, year-round blend uses a precise 60:40 ratio of malty Assam Broken Pekoe and color-rich Dooars Orange Fannings to deliver a strong, kadak profile. The resulting liquor is bright and thick, maintaining a smooth flavor even after the addition of milk. It is primarily utilized by independent grocers and established tea brands that require a fixed taste profile to ensure customer loyalty. The commercial value of Rajni Gold lies in its blend consistency and excellent yield, allowing retailers to compete with national brands while maintaining superior profit margins. This high-grade blend is now available in bulk packaging and durable jars for ease of transport and storage. Supplied by a wholesale tea supplier based in Siliguri, serving Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal.

Begam Gold is a heavy-liquoring CTC tea blend designed specifically for the demanding markets of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh where strength and color are paramount. Sourced from select garden invoices in the Dooars region, this blend produces a deep, dark red infusion that is characteristic of the popular Lal Ghoda style teas. It is highly resistant to flavor loss during rigorous boiling, making it a favorite for traditional milk-based tea preparations. Wholesalers and local distributors find Begam Gold advantageous due to its high cuppage and ability to cut through hard water conditions common in the northern plains. This robust product offers a commercial edge by providing the intense sensory profile that wholesale consumers expect at a price point that supports high-volume distribution. It is a workhorse for traders targeting the semi-urban and rural mass-market segment. Supplied by a wholesale tea supplier based in Siliguri, serving Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal.

Saavan Tea represents a premium selection of garden-fresh CTC tea plucked during the peak monsoon season when the tea bushes are at their most vibrant. The large, black, and uniform granules are aesthetically superior, making this an excellent choice for premium loose tea retailers and boutique brands. Sourced from reputable estates in West Bengal, Saavan Tea is vacuum-tested for freshness to ensure its lively character is preserved from the garden to the final user. Its primary utility is for customers who prefer a fresher, more aromatic cup over heavy-liquoring varietals. This product offers retailers a unique selling point based on seasonality and purity, attracting health-conscious and quality-focused consumers. Despite its cost-effective pricing, Priya Gold delivers a strong caffeine kick and deep color that satisfy the requirements of a commercial chai preparation. Sourced from high-yielding gardens in Assam and Dooars, it provides a consistent solution for business owners who must balance cost-per-cup with flavor intensity. Nepal High Grown Orthodox tea is a premium whole-leaf product sourced from the high-altitude Himalayan estates of the Ilam region. This SFTGFOP1 grade tea is selected for its highly aromatic and floral profile, offering a light amber liquor with distinct fruity notes. It shares a geographic heritage with Darjeeling teas but provides a unique value proposition for retailers looking to offer high-end leaf tea at competitive wholesale price points. The leaves are carefully twisted and wiry, indicating the gentle orthodox processing that preserves the delicate essential oils of the plant. It is primarily used by tea boutiques, luxury hotels, and export-focused traders who cater to consumers preferring tea without milk. The commercial benefit of Nepal High Grown lies in its exceptional quality-to-price ratio, allowing boutique brands to build a premium image with high margins. Unlike secondary dust, this primary stock is free from fiber and stalks, ensuring a clean and consistent brew every time.
